reviewText: Have you read the negative reviews? My bluray didn't play, not as good as....., zombies aren't funny. Yes I like the Walking Dead too, can't wait till the season starts back up again. But this movie is in a whole different class.  And if it was indeed a low budget movie, then good for them. I thought the acting was excellent, special effects were up to par with any of the current movies if not better.  Warning, it is very gory.And yes, I found lots of flaws with the film such as shooting your automatic weapons at zombies while your mates stood right behind the zombies they were shooting at. Sorry, but I was laughing too hard to hold it against them.This movie is a comedy and a well done one if you ask me.  If you like serious, sad and weepy eyed zombie movies, then this is not for you. If you want a lot of character development and want to feel empathy with the characters, then this movie is not for you. If you want to laugh your arse off, then watch this movie with no preconceived expectations and I can almost guarantee you will enjoy it.
summary: Best Zombie Movie Ever! Haven't laugh that much in a very long time

reviewText: Once you've seen The Walking Dead, nothing really compares. I've watched great zombie movies like 28 Weeks Later, Dawn of the Dead, and Zombie Apocalypse. This movie didn't come close. If you like watching senior citizens fight off zombies who move slower than an old man in a walker, this is the movie for you. The music was horrible and the action was laughable. This was more like Shaun of the Dead. I don't like comedy served up with my zombies. The makeup and special effects were decent, but I'm sad I wasted $3.99 and almost hours of my life I will never get back.

reviewText: Dont go in expecting Sean of the Dead.  There is no comparison.  It is a zombie movie set in England and shows the outbreak as it starts.  Several people try to rob a bank and a zombie outbreak occurs.  They are in a standoff with the police and when they come out to have it out with them everyone is gone.  This sets up the rest of the movie as to why the bank was being robbed and where the robbers are going.  It is a good movie and definitely a renter.  If you must have all zombie movies then you will want to buy it when it comes out.  Check it out, you wont be disappointed.  7 bucks to rent it now to watch it is a decent deal.  I thought the effects were decent, minimal cgi and good acting.
summary: Good, not great.  Decent English Zombie Movie

reviewText: The title basically says it. Multi-generations of Cockneys deal with an zombie invasion. Well-paced, fun, with some appearances by unexpected actors like Honor Blackman who played Pussy Galore in the James Bond movie Goldfinger. It's not quite as much fun as Attack the Block, (Aliens vs. South London housing estate gang) but would make a great creature double-feature if you're feeling you need a bit of Blighty in your fright night.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I know that previous reviewers have compared this movie to "Shawn of the Dead" but seriously Shawn was a classic, original movie while this movie is just going for a couple of laughs.  Granted that both movies take place in London and have zombies skulking about but these are two completely different movies.  Besides compared to the disaster of a movie called World War Z, this movie was way more entertaining!!Cockneys vs. Zombies is a hilarious take of what might happen if zombies decide to invade the East End of London.  The reactions from the inhabitants of the East End are both matter of fact and gut wrenchingly funny.  There were certain parts of the movie which had me laughing even after the movie was over.  IMHO, this movie is a great way to get your mind off things for about 90 minutes.One final point, this movie also has the stunningly beautiful Michelle Ryan (who was previously the Bionic Woman).  Just watching her stroll around England and unload a couple of rounds into zombies was well worth the price of watching the movie!!
summary: Great Fun (Plus Michelle Ryan is in it!)

reviewText: Well folks,  I watched this movie and enjoyed it.  From the descriptions, it is supposed to be funny--so I was thinking along the style of "Shaun of the Dead", or "Zombieland".  Nope. Most of the humor attempts didn't even spark a chuckle.  Makeup effects were good and the story wasn't bad. (No spoilers here)  For the fans of zombie genre, I almost never call a tacky zombie movie "campy".  That word is over-used.  Campy means a bunch of young, nubile women that are staying at a cabin in the woods or tents that get over-run by whatever the monster of the day is.  This movie isn't "campy".  You will not find a biography of any actors or directors here-just (hopefully) an idea of what the movie is about.  The title of the movie is an accurate description of the movie. One can often tell if the show is bad by the make-up effects.  Enjoy!

reviewText: I'd heard from a friend that this movie was a great take on the zombie genre, and I'm glad I took her advice. This movie is in the same group of movies as Shaun of the Dead and Doghouse, where comedy is blended with traditionally frightening zombies.The movie follows a group of ill-fated bank robbers as they find their former home has been infested with zombies following the resurrection of a previously-buried tomb containing some sort of evilness. This same struggle is also experienced by a group of retirees, who are equally reluctant to let zombies take them without a fight. The two groups fight the slow hordes and make for some good laughs along the way.Between punting a baby, "he's eating a foot...", shotgun-wielding wheelchair-bound retirees, and gross blood splatters, this movie is fantastic for a Saturday night flick. Not scary but still entertaining.

reviewText: If it wasn't for the swearing (meaning kids can't watch) I'd give it five stars.The hidden story is that the folks in the rest home are part of the "greatest generation" who fought the Nazis and still are feisty. The speech of the grand-dad at the end about how they had defended that land for centuries was perfect.When they were being rescued, they were faced with using ladder and when they balked, the rescuers asked, "Is there anyone hear who HASN'T had a hip replacement???"Also the two zombie soccer teams that ignored the living to fight amongst themselves was a good laugh, "Look! They're dead and they still hate each other!"Not a great film, but full of British humor.

reviewText: Cockneys vs. Zombies is a great title, right? It evokes this vague image of funny-accented (at least to American ears) salt-of-the-earth tough guys taking on unspeaking and unspeakable horrors fresh out of the earth. This movie delivers, but not a whole truckload of fun like you'd imagine.The story follows two brothers, Terry and Andy, as they get ready to rob a bank. Money isn't their motivation. No, they want to save their granddad's old age home from evil developers who want to put up condos. They put together a band of misfits to do the job but things get cocked up when the zombie apocalypse starts in the middle of their standoff with the police outside the bank.Meanwhile, we follow the story of the granddad, who is a war vet. He lives in an old-age home with a few (surprisingly few, actually) characters who could have been more colorful. They become his band of brothers when the zombies show up. The humor on this side of the story is better. One guy is sleeping in the back garden when the zombies come. They ignore him. The people inside realize he's still out there. They wake him by shouting which also draws the zombies' attention. He grabs his walker and has the slowest chase scene as the zombies stagger after him, almost within reach.The set up is interesting but the rest of the movie doesn't pay off in a satisfying way, as either a horror film or a comedy. Everyone seems to be casually skillful at killing zombies, regardless of whether they've held a gun before or not. None of the surprises or twists are unpredictable, which could be okay if they were more enjoyable (the walker/zombie chase being an exception). I found the film dragging at the end, which is surprising when the movie is only 87 minutes long.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I enjoy horror movies and zombie movies.  This being said, please be clear that this is a zombie comedy (zomcom).  While a British movie, it has no connection with Shaun of the Dead other than the British accents (so comparisons to that movie are off base and misleading).Spoilers / PlotTwo young, slacker-type men are planning a bank heist.  Their "crew" consists of their attractive female cousin, a deranged war vet  (with a metal plate in his head), and a buddy that qualifies among the worlds least dangerous criminals (captured when he started to flirt with the clerk he was robbing, who promptly grabbed his weapon and ko'd him).As these are the "heroes", there is a rather minimal yet awkward subplot about vague corporate corruption so the money they end up taking is from the obligatory evil corporation -- gotta keep folks liking the characters, dontcha know.  Of course, they are doing this to "save" their grandfather's retirement home from being razed by aforementioned evil corporation.The zombies are released from an old crypt that is uncovered at a construction site nearby.  Not a lot of depth to this idea, just zombies that have been interred yet waiting to burst out in the modern day.  The zombies are your typical Romero shambler type - slow moving and bites are fatal and cause one to become a zombie.The action of the story is the two brothers, their crew (and hostages) reacting to the ZA and then deciding to go and try and rescue grandpa.  Gramps, a cantankerous and fit WWII vet, is a delight in the film.  The retirement home is the scene of the worlds slowest chase scene (done well) of a poorly shambling zombie chasing a pensioner in a walker (don't worry, the old man survives)Overall, I did enjoy the show.  I like how some of the characters history and outlook is explained via brief flashback -- frankly some of the best scenes in the movie.  Decent to above average zombie effects with some nice attention to detail help a lot.  The plot is not deep by any means, so no tortured examination of the human soul during the ZA here.  Just a decently made zomcom that is fun and a major cut above much of the low grade zombie cinema out there.
summary: Fun movie even with its flaws

reviewText: I saw this in the theater last night and laughed all the way through it.  Alan Ford's performance alone was worth the ticket, but the writing was MUCH sharper than I thought it would be, the direction was MUCH more creative than I thought it would be, and the sense of humor was MUCH smarter than I thought it would be.  It's just a wacky version of the old western "defend the homestead against the invaders" plot, and it totally works because the characters play it straight.  Be prepared for gore galore.  For me, that was a good thing.  Great fun!
summary: Took me by surprise in the best way!

reviewText: This has a terrible title, but it's a really well made film. It had a major theatrical release and it  has some really good actors in it , like Honor blackman.  The film has a lot of humor in it and it utilizes the elderly as heroes!: who fight the zombie plague. The film is definitely part zomedy , but it's also straight zombie action as well. There are some classic scenes in this one , and that says a lot for a genre that has been done to death in the last 35 years! I can't imagine any zombie of comedy fan not liking this flick. I wont spoil the humor by laying down the best scenes , but I will say that it does have a horrible scene that is funny in spite of itself , as a man throws a zombie infant at a billboard sign , that warns people about being safe!.  Things like that and the whole film are slanted towards humor , which unlike lets say 'a little bit zombie' don't go into parody territory , instead it's just part of the flicks demented structure. This is a first class zombie flick on all levels. It's a higher budget flick , done in England and it's worth your money.  the hd transfer is excellent, but in some scenes you really have to listen as the cockney accent is very present here!.  The film utitlizes lots of great british rock songs as well in the soundtrack.  I have seen so many zombie flicks and this is one of the better ones out there. It's really funny and well done, with great special effects  and a tight script and budget. This is  A british a lister for sure.

reviewText: ‘Cockneys vs Zombies’ is the first major film directed and written by up and comer Matthias Hoene. We open the film with a group of young bank robbers who are modern day Robin Hoods. Well to a point. One of them is a hardcore gang member and the rest are just trying to get the funds to make an anonymous donation to the leader’s father’s old folks home. The place is going out of business and they want to find a way to keep it open and this seems to be it.Things ‘mostly’ go well until in the middle of it we see that a zombie outbreak is going on from a nearby burial ground that had been opened up. Oh yea, zombie curse that brings forth the undead.While they are on the run from the cops they also have a few hostages, one of them which is getting friendly with the robbers while another can’t keep his mouth shut long enough to stay alive. He somehow does though, for much more of the film than he had any right to.Still we see quite a bit of the robbers vs the undead as well as those who are surviving in the old folks home fighting zombies. There are some great scenes to be found within and some great humor though some of it was probably a bit too British for my taste.This is not a perfect zombie movie but it’s not something you’ll regret picking up to check out. I think if they had kept the entire book focused on the old folks the film would have worked out being quite a bit better. Still, it’s worth a view.
summary: Not the best zombedy out there but a fun watch

reviewerName: The Movie Guy "Movies from A to Z"
reviewText: A construction crew opens a vault/tomb that was sealed during the Great Plague of London. This unleashes a zombie outbreak. The film concentrates on the old folks home and the young adults who rob a bank to get the money to save the home. Brothers Terry (Rasmus Hardiker) and Andy (Harry Treadaway) head up the group. They are aided by their cousin Katy (Michelle Ryan), bumbling ex-con David (Jack Doolan), and Mental Mickey (Ashley Thomas). Georgia King plays a hostage the guys try to pick up after they kidnap her.The film is a comedy and not a horror production as expected. It is not knee-slapping funny, but did make me laugh at some unique scenes such as drop kicking a zombie baby, attempting to kill a zombie with a metal plate in his head, a zombie gang fight, and of course the chase scene of a foot dragging zombie pursuing a man with a walker. Zombie fans just have to love it.Parental Guide: Plenty of F-bombs, no sex or nudity.
summary: WHAT WOULD MOM AND DAD HAVE DONE?

reviewText: In the tradition of Shaun of the Dead comes another British zombie horror/comedy Cockneys Vs. Zombies.  Cockneys refers to the nickname of those working class Brits who live in London’s East End.  Two construction workers uncover a tomb sealed in the 17th century and unwittingly unleash its blood-thirsty inhabitants on the city.  Meanwhile brothers Terry and Andy have planned a bank robbery with several of their friends in order to save their grandfather’s retirement home from being torn down.  The robbery attempt goes awry and the group soon finds themselves inside the back surrounded by cops.  As they plan their next move they look out to see all of the cops dead.  Making their getaway, they soon find the city crawling with zombies.As the group of would be bank robbers seeks refuge from the undead in an abandoned warehouse, the boys grandfather Ray and several other elderly residents of the retirement home are trapped in the kitchen by the zombies.  Among those are Peggy, played by Honor Blackman best known as Bond Girl Pussy Galore in Goldfinger, and longtime British TV star Richard Briers as Hamish, who passed away earlier this year.While not on the same level of Shaun of the Dead in terms of gut-busting laughs, Cockneys Vs. Zombies has some standout comedic moments, most of them involving the senior citizens.  One scene finds Hamish, who requires a walker, trying to “out run” the shambling zombies.  In fact the film has two distinct tones.  While the retirement home is lighter and filled with laughs, the bank robber’s parts are played more for straight horror.  When the brothers hijack a double-decker bus in order to save their grandfather, the two distinct stories mix together for a nice blend of horror and humor.  Alan Ford is a cast standout as the boys’ tough, former gangster grandfather.Overall a good deal of fun and the blu-ray comes with two audio commentaries, and some behind-the-scenes featurettes.
summary: Not Shaun of the Dead but OK
Title: N/A

reviewText: "Cockneys Vs. Zombies" is a nice little time waster for a Saturday night when your date falls through.Although it breaks no new ground in the zombie arena, it is still highly entertaining. The characters are well thought out, and the actors are competent in their roles.We even get a "Doctor Who" alumni playing one of the retirement home oldies (see if you can figure out which one). Although I thought the film ran a bit long, that is a minor quibble.I've always found British production values to stand head-and-shoulder above most U.S. efforts, with "Cockneys Vs. Zombies being a good example.You could really do a lot worse than picking up this flick.

reviewText: To save the local elderly people's home, two young brothers Andy (Harry Treadaway) and Terry (Rasmus Hardiker) plan a bank robbery, but on the very day they rob the bank with a ragtag team of misfits, a zombie outbreak happens at the nearby construction site in East End of London.As the film's title suggests, a UK horror comedy "Cockneys vs Zombies" does not take itself very seriously. It is a mildly entertaining time killer, with a few familiar faces of veteran players like Alan Ford and Honor Blackman (remember "Goldfinger"?), but don't expect something witty and hilarious like "Shaun of the Dead" or "Zombieland."I admit I didn't get Cockney word play, but even so, the film is weak in its narrative structure that makes the story choppy and incomplete. In "Cockneys vs Zombies" the story jumps back and forth between two groups for the considerable amount of time. Also, some of the slapstick jokes ("Look behind you!") are repetitious and unfunny; even some characters like trigger-happy Mickey is just annoying."Cockneys vs Zombies" is yet another zombie-related comedy that could have been more entertaining with better jokes and more gores. There are a few nice gags and Alan Ford and Honor Blackman brandishing guns steal every scene they are in, but their characters (especially Blackman's), as well as Michelle Ryan (of "Eastenders"), are underused. It's an amusing ride, but perhaps could have been funnier with more scenes of veteran players.
summary: Zombie Outbreak in East End of London: So-so Zombie-Related Comedy
Title: N/A

reviewText: This one is mediocre in many ways, with okay acting and an okay plot. The make-up jobs on most of the zombies are C-grade at best, but I don't think anyone watches this thinking it's a top-budget film. There are a few cool special effects thrown in a points.What sets this ho-hum-okay zombie flick apart from the sea of others out there are the little bits of dark humor peppered here and there. I don't want to mention any specifically and ruin the surprise for other viewers, but they're pretty darn good and many made me chuckle out loud. It's not a laugh-a-minute riot, but when they're good, they're GOOD.Think poor man's Shawn of the Dead on this one. If you enjoyed that one, you will probably enjoy this one as well.
summary: Nothing spectacular, but great humor sprinkled in really improves it

reviewText: A fun take on the zombie apocalypse genre.  This movie has most of the major zombie movie traits.  The characters standout, though, and work well together.  The movie subplot holds the movie together and moves the story along quickly, though the motive is revealed a little later in the movie.  I really enjoy this genre; comedy, action, horror zombie movie.  This is another great example.  Maybe not as good or polished as Shawn of the Dead, but it comes close.
summary: Funny, fast paced moments and heartwarming
